title: Shadowblade
data:

|                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |

**Shadwoblade** is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") that appears in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"). It is [chaotic](/wiki/Chaotic "Chaotic"), and its [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is an [athame](/wiki/Athame "Athame") made of [adamantine](/wiki/Adamantine "Adamantine").

## Generation

Shadowblade can only be created by combining [Werebane](/wiki/Werebane "Werebane") and [Stormbringer](/wiki/Stormbringer "Stormbringer") at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") - it cannot be [wished](/wiki/Wish "Wish") for, and will revert to its base item if left in a [bones](/wiki/Bones "Bones") file.

## Description

Shadowblade has +1d8 [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit"), and deals +1d10 damage and drains a level from [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") without [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") as Stormbringer does, though it is not [bloodthirsty](/wiki/Bloodthirsty "Bloodthirsty") and will not attack [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet") and peaceful monsters. [Rogues](/wiki/Rogue "Rogue") wielding Shadowblade as their primary weapon gain a ([XL](/wiki/XL "XL")/2 + 1) bonus to [backstab](/wiki/Backstab "Backstab") damage with it. Shadowblade is also considered a [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") weapon for the purposes of racial to-hit bonuses.

While wielded, Shadowblade also confers [stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth"), [searching](/wiki/Searching "Searching"), drain resistance, and [warns of lycanthropes](/wiki/Warned_of_monster_type "Warned of monster type") as Werebane does. [Invoking](/wiki/Invoking "Invoking") Shadowblade can either [cause fear](/wiki/Cause_fear "Cause fear") or create an aura of darkness. Attacking near [sleeping](/wiki/Sleeping "Sleeping") monsters is significantly less likely to wake them if wielding Shadowblade.

Though it is considered a drow weapon and made of adamantine, Shadowblade will not break if used in lit areas.

## Encyclopedia entry

Shrouded in darkness, those that wield Shadowblade can instill  
fear into the hearts of those who would dare go against them.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Shadowblade\&action=edit)*

Shadowblade

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)   Shadowblade    
Base item athame
Damage vs. small 1d4 +1d10
Damage vs. large 1d3 +1d10
To-hit bonus +1d8
Bonus versus non-drain resistant
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Affiliation
  • chaotic
  • Rogue
  • drow
  • intelligent artifacts
  • forged artifacts
When carried

(none)

When wielded
  • stealth
  • searching
  • drain resistance
  • warned of lycanthropes
  • bonuses to backstabs as primary weapon
When invoked
  • cause fear
  • create darkness
Base price 15000 zm
Weight 6
Material adamantine

Shadwoblade is an artifact weapon that appears in EvilHack. It is chaotic, and its base item is an athame made of adamantine.

Generation

Shadowblade can only be created by combining Werebane and Stormbringer at a forge - it cannot be wished for, and will revert to its base item if left in a bones file.

Description

Shadowblade has +1d8 to-hit, and deals +1d10 damage and drains a level from monsters without drain resistance as Stormbringer does, though it is not bloodthirsty and will not attack pets and peaceful monsters. Rogues wielding Shadowblade as their primary weapon gain a (XL/2 + 1) bonus to backstab damage with it. Shadowblade is also considered a drow weapon for the purposes of racial to-hit bonuses.

While wielded, Shadowblade also confers stealth, searching, drain resistance, and warns of lycanthropes as Werebane does. Invoking Shadowblade can either cause fear or create an aura of darkness. Attacking near sleeping monsters is significantly less likely to wake them if wielding Shadowblade.

Though it is considered a drow weapon and made of adamantine, Shadowblade will not break if used in lit areas.

Encyclopedia entry

Shrouded in darkness, those that wield Shadowblade can instill
fear into the hearts of those who would dare go against them.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.
